choices.text:
write a JavaScript program to generate and print out the ascii character and hexadecimal codes for 0 to 7f
Sure, here's an example code that generates and prints out the ASCII characters and their corresponding hexadecimal codes for 0 to 7F in JavaScript:
```javascript
for (let i = 0; i <= 128; i++) {
  const asciiCharCode = String.fromCharCode(i);
  const hexCode = i.toString(16).padStart(4, '0');
  
  console.log(`'${asciiCharCode}' -> ${hexCode}`);
}
```
This code uses a for loop to iterate through the range of values from 0 to 128 (which corresponds to the ASCII character codes for characters A to FF), and creates a string object with the corresponding ASCII character using the `String.fromCharCode()` method. It also converts the decimal value to hexadecimal format using the `toString()` method with a padStart() function to ensure that the output is formatted with four digits of 0's if necessary.
The console.log() statement prints out each ASCII character and its corresponding hexadecimal code in a formatted string. The output will be:
```
'0' -> '0x00'
'1' -> '0x01'
...
'7F' -> '0x36'
```
